Package memory

Class Memory

java.lang.Object
memory.Memory
All Implemented Interfaces:
CodeReader, CodeWriter, RAM
public class Memory extends Object implements CodeReader, CodeWriter
An implementation of the RAM, CodeReader, CodeWriter interfaces.

TODO: some overflow/underflow maybe, or just mod(0x10000) each value written

Alex Mandelias

    • writeChars

      public void writeChars​(int address, char[] values)
      Description copied from interface: RAM
      Writes an array of char values starting at address.
      Specified by:
      writeChars in interface RAM
      Parameters:
      address - the address of the first value
      values - the array of values to write
      Implementation Specification:
      The number of individual values written is saved in the higher bits of the cell at address. The actual values are 16-bits integers, and are stored in pairs in consecutive addresses. The odd-indexed values are written in the stored in the high bits and the even-indexed values in the low bits of the cell, starting at the given address.

    • getDumpSize

      public int getDumpSize()
      Description copied from interface: CodeReader
      Returns the number a for which exists number b such that: 
        -  a > b
  -  a * b = size()
  -  |a - b| is minimum among all {(a, b) : a * b = size()}
      Specified by:
      getDumpSize in interface CodeReader
      Returns:
      the number a
